trans-unit.source: A vibrating wire may be used as an instrument with a variety of applications, one of which is the measurement of magnetic fields. Often, the magnetic fields are determined by measuring the amplitude of the wire vibration under the action of a Lorentz force. Though generally adequate, this approach may be inconvenient in certain circumstances. One of these occurs when it is necessary to measure the amplitude of high-frequency vibration, as the amplitude is expected to decrease linearly with frequency, and thus becomes harder to measure. Another example may be found in situations where the sensor must operate over a wide range of vibration frequencies. In this case the sensor will be unresponsive to specific frequencies of wire vibration, which are determined by the placement of the sensor. This means that for the instrument to be robust, the sensor must be precisely mobile, or multiple sensors must be used.
trans-unit.target: 振动线可以作为一种仪器，有多种应用，其中之一是磁场的测量。磁场通常是通过测量导线在洛伦兹力作用下振动的振幅来确定的。虽然这种方法在一般情况下是足够的，但在某些情况下可能不方便。其中一种情况发生在需要测量高频振动的振幅时，因为振幅预计会随频率线性减小，从而变得难以测量。另一个例子可能是在传感器必须工作在一个大范围的振动频率。在这种情况下，传感器将对特定频率的导线振动无响应，这是由传感器的位置决定的。这意味着，为了使仪器坚固耐用，传感器必须精确地移动，或者必须使用多个传感器。

trans-unit.source: Here a technique which may be used to supplement the displacement sensor is described. This technique makes use of the voltage generated by the motion of the wire in the magnetic field under measurement. It is predicted that the technique may be more suitable for measurements requiring high frequency vibration, and is sensitive to all frequencies of vibration. Measurements of a magnetic field obtained using this technique are compared to those found using only a displacement sensor, and the benefits and drawbacks of the technique are discussed.
trans-unit.target: 这里描述了一种可用于补充位移传感器的技术。该技术利用导线在被测磁场中运动产生的电压。预测该技术可能更适合于需要高频振动的测量，并且对所有频率的振动都很敏感。将该技术与仅使用位移传感器进行的磁场测量结果进行了比较，并讨论了该技术的优缺点。
